content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I agree, Test 2 allow people without musical knowledge to find the solution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A bit complicated, but I guess from Test 2 everyone can decipher the "code" even if he/she does not realize that they are notes or does not know anything about notes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good usage of the reverse mode, inputs are clear enough to guess what the  purpose of the CoC, thanx to "Test 2". Solution can be found in less than 5 minutes once you guess what to do.

I like reverse puzzle and I think this one is good ! Of course there are multiples notation system for music but I think you don't need to know that to be able to solve this puzzle. Like Gorbit said, test 2 is helpfull for this.
@Gorbit : Don't you think your inputs can be more simple to guess using "o" rather than "x" ? Because "o" looks more like a music note to me.

Even though I know very little about music, it was obvious that this puzzle requieres music notes. With that said, I had absolutely no idea how to debug this without looking at your code, although Iove reverse puzzles. I think what threw me off the most is that both "E" and "F" are represented twice. That's so unusual concept that I find it very hard to imagine most of the players will find this out.

My main concern is that 6 of 8 players will not be able to solve this at all which means 6 of 8 people just got frustrated after this one. To be honest, even if I could solve a CoC like this, I am very frustrated (regardless of winning or not).

Although I must say, I like your solution a lot. Very nice.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Do you assume that the majority here knows anything about music? If puzzle requires googling to solve it's not acceptable
I don't think it's a good idea, since this notation system is not universal. That will be obvious for ones and not for others.
I know, I am also in a country where the notation is a bit different, that's the sole reason testcase 2 exists

No, I don't, I myself know almost nothing about music, and you don't even need to, testcase #2 has been created for the sole purpose of serving as basically a guide. Even if you don't know anything about music, you can just say "ok, if a circle appears in row 2, that means an E"

It's a bit hard to have a go at reverse puzzles in the same way as one would with a fastest/shortest one. I made the testcases, especially testcase 2 in a way that makes players who have no clue about what music notation even is in the first place be able to complete this challenge. Of course that one doesn't get shown when trying it out as a normal puzzle
I had a small issue with it not standing out enough in front of the "background", but I can change it at least temporarily to see which is better
Changed the xs to os, tell me if you like it better this way
Seems better to me !

I mean it's not that different to validate a reverse only puzzle. The adventage you have is seeing the title which usually gives away some clues but nothing relevant in this case. So usually I look at all the test cases and validators and try to figure it out without reading the description, comments or the solution. All I'm saying is the fact that if E and F are double represented than this one is already much harder than most of the CoCs. I can't recall a single puzzle or CoC from the top of my head where the some objects had 1 representation while others had more.

In what sense is it harder? To be honest I can't imagine a possible solution where this would be any sort of limitation. The scale sadly can't change as that's just how music works, as far as I'm aware.

This is not a limitation to the solution obviously. This is a limitation on what people are used to. As a software engineer I would immediately reject any representation like this. The mixed representation of unique and non-unique for the same type of objects always-always will backfire later on. I know that this is how the notes are represented but I don't have to like it. I think this gives away a wrong message.

Also please note I'm not rejecting it just because I have a strong preference against it. And consistency is never checked and no one really cares about. I'm sorry to have started on this conversation.
Ah, I see, guess it's a fault of the medium

Yes, reading back, it might not be very clear in my messages. Although I must admit even after understanding the solution and task it took me an awful lot of time to realise that this is how the empty music books look like. Probably because I haven't seen one in decades. :D
I agree with Gorbit99.

I disagree with mihei, I usually use google when playing CoC, at least for documentation. Players got 15 minutes max to submit an answer, they can google for "FEDCBAGFE" and get a clear result of what is excepted at first answer. Even if player don't google, I think he can solve this only base on the inputs/outputs set.
